summary: The diff implements the requested social-proof popup system with configurable timing/lists and storage-backed non-repeating name logic, and it appears to add the requested trust indicator under the registration CTA. One key REQ-2 acceptance criterion is not met based on the popup text layout: the popup message is split across two lines rather than displaying the exact single-string format.

missing_requirements.requirement: A notification card appears in the bottom-left corner of the landing page and displays exactly: “{Name} from {City} registered {TimeAgo}”.
missing_requirements.reason:
The popup UI renders the message in two separate

elements: the first shows “{Name} from {City}” and the second shows “registered {TimeAgo}”, rather than displaying the exact full string as a single continuous text line.

hallucinated_features.description: Global theme/palette changes introducing a warm amber/orange OKLCH color system across light/dark modes.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest focuses on adding a trust indicator and lightweight social-proof popups; it does not request global color palette changes.

hallucinated_features.description: Changes to the registration mutation hook for “robust error normalization” and mapping authorization/permission errors to user-friendly messages.
hallucinated_features.reason: The BuildRequest explicitly states not to change the existing registration submission flow; enhancing mutation error normalization is not requested for the UI-only trust indicator / popup work.
